oai_dc:dc.dc:description: WOMEN AND CITY POLITICS TOPIC Mrs. L. Crozier French Will Address Morristown Club Feb. 22 On Important Subject "Activities of Women in the Problems of a City Government," will be the subject of an address to be delivered by Mrs. L. Crozier French, president of Ossoli circle at the citizenship day program of Somo Sala circle, February 22, at Morristown. This will be the leading address of the day; other five minute talks being given by different members as follows: "Types of City Government." "Mayor and Council Type"—Mrs. Harris. "Commission Forb"—Mrs. Witt. "City Manager Plan"—Mrs. Phillips. The theme for the subjects under discussion is suggested by the quotation from Lowell which heads the program: "New occasions teach new duties; Time makes ancient good uncouth." The Morristown club is greatly interested in a practical solution of some of the problems which face every community, and hopes to follow up the discussions by some action that shall result in permanent good to all concerned. It is particularly fortunate in securing as a speaker Mrs. L. Crozier French who is one of Knoxville's most active and brilliant club women, and who has been for some time at the head of Ossoli circle.
